item.title: EDT pub attracts vermin due to no waste management, 6th August
item.description:
The photo of the state of the back of the EDT pub (on Spurling Road) is an extremely common site. It's disgusting for the residents and passers-by, it is a vermin infestation risk, and commonly it blocks passageway. The pub takes no care over this and scenes like this occur every week. I could send dozens of similar photos covering just the last couple of months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds and plants need cleaning from the street., 6th August
item.description:
Hi, there have been large weeds growing on the pavement and kerbs now for a while, can that be arranged to be cleared? Some are getting quite large and this issue has been present all year. It’s the councils responsibility to maintain public highways, including removing weeds that grow on pavements.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayward Close, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No pavement access on Spurling Road due to EDT pub, 6th August
item.description:
The EDT pub constantly (and for as long as I can remember, many months) has all their bins on the pavement of Spurling Road (the back of the pub) which blocks access for wheelchair users and parents with prams, as you can see from the photo. Even a single pedestrian has to pass by the signpost sideways.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
